content:
Kenya bars athletes from global travel over coronavirus worries
Kenya's athletics authority said on Thursday it had barred its athletes from travelling to international events due to concerns over the coronavirus outbreak. The suspension announcement comes a day after the World Health Organization labelled the outbreak a pandemic.
ESPN • 3/12/2020
Trump's travel ban won't have much impact on spread of coronavirus, says Rishi Sunak - live news
Rolling coverage of the day’s political developments as they happen
The Guardian • 3/12/2020
Trump, in Oval Office address, announces travel ban from Europe amid coronavirus fears: 'Put politics aside'
Good morning and welcome to Fox News First. Here's what you need to know as you start your day ... Trump announces travel ban from Europe amid growing fears of coronavirus President Trump on Wednesday announced in a televised address that the U.S. was suspending all travel from Europe to the U.S. for 30 days beginning Friday at midnight in an ...
Fox News • 3/12/2020
U.S. advises citizens to reconsider travel abroad due to coronavirus
The U.S. State Department issued a travel advisory on its website on Wednesday, advising citizens to reconsider travel abroad due to the global impact of the coronavirus outbreak and countries’ response to it.
Reuters • 3/11/2020
Ban on European travel to U.S. will batter airlines, already roiled by coronavirus
The new U.S. ban on foreign citizens entering the country if they have traveled to Europe in recent weeks will heap more pressure on airlines already reeling from the coronavirus pandemic, hitting European carriers the hardest,
Reuters • 3/11/2020
American suspends pilot hiring as coronavirus takes a toll on travel
American Airlines is suspending pilot hiring as the rapid spread of coronavirus hurts. This is the latest measure by a major carrier to stem the pain of the coronavirus travel slump. American Airlines is suspending pilot hiring as the rapid spread of coronavirus hurts the travel industry, according to a note from the company, the latest ...
CNBC • 3/11/2020
Coronavirus: Asian stocks fall as US imposes EU travel ban
Asian stocks traded sharply lower on Thursday after President Donald Trump suspended all travel to the US from mainland Europe in a bid to slow the spread of the coronavirus. It followed steep losses on Wall Street with the Dow Jones plunging by almost 1,500 points, or 5.8%. The Dow is now more than 20% below its recent high, a threshold that ...
BBC • 3/11/2020
What you need to know about Trump's travel ban from Europe due to coronavirus
Travelers are scrambling after President Donald Trump announced a travel suspension from Europe for the next 30 days to try to slow the spread of the coronavirus. Here's what travelers need to know: What's included in the ban? Trump said the administration would restrict “all travel” to the U.S. from Europe, which is reeling from the ...
USA Today • 3/11/2020
Saudi Arabia Widens Travel Ban to Europe, Others Over Coronavirus
RIYADH — Saudi Arabia has extended flight and travel bans over coronavirus fears to include the European Union and 12 other countries after announcing 24 new cases overnight to bring its total to 45, state media reported on Thursday. Citizens and residents in the affected jurisdictions have 72 hours to return to the kingdom, state news agency ...
New York Times • 3/11/2020
Stocks and oil fall after US announces coronavirus travel ban
Global stocks and oil sold off sharply on Thursday after the US temporarily suspended travel from Europe in response to the coronavirus outbreak, triggering a flurry of panic selling that sent US stock futures into a tailspin. US President Donald Trump announced the move in a televised address hours after the World Health Organization said ...
The Financial Times • 3/11/2020
Trump announces all travel from Europe to be restricted amid coronavirus threat
Amid growing public anxiety over the novel coronavirus, President Donald Trump announced that the United States is suspending all travel from Europe to the United States for a month, starting Friday. "To keep new cases from entering our shores, we will be suspending all travel from Europe to the United States for the next 30 days," Trump ...
ABC • 3/11/2020
Coronavirus US Update: Trump Suspends Travel Between US And Europe
President Donald Trump has suspended all travel between the United States and Europe, except the UK, for the next 30 days. The restriction has been put in place to prevent people infected with the coronavirus from coming into the United States from Europe. Italy now has the second highest highest death toll from COVID-19, behind China.
International Business Times • 3/11/2020
Trump Is Suspending All Travel From Europe To The United States As The Coronavirus Continues To Spread
By Stephanie K. Baer Last updated on March 11, 2020, at 9:15 p.m. ET Posted on March 11, 2020, at 9:13 p.m. ET The US is suspending all travel from the Europe to the United States for at least 30 days in an effort to stop new clusters of the novel coronavirus from sprouting across the country. President Donald Trump announced the new sweeping ...
BuzzFeed News • 3/11/2020
US has restricted travel to and from these countries amid coronavirus pandemic
warned Americans to avoid all nonessential travel to multiple countries, including Italy, which largely has been in a lockdown state amid a surge in coronavirus infections. Other nations included South Korea, China and Iran. The agency also has warned Americans to take extra precautions when traveling to Japan. Earlier this month, Trump hinted ...
Fox News • 3/11/2020
Coronavirus prompts LV to pull out of travel cover
A well known insurance brand has temporarily abandoned selling travel insurance as a result of the spread of coronavirus. LV= said it had decided to stop selling the cover rather than hike prices. The company said it had seen a doubling in the number of policies sold over the last couple of weeks, as travellers rush to protect themselves.
BBC • 3/11/2020
Coronavirus Outbreak Prompts Trump to Question Travel Policies to Europe
President Trump raised concerns about the spread of the novel coronavirus in Europe and said there weren’t strict enough travel restrictions on the continent during a meeting with banking executives on Wednesday .
Wall Street Journal • 3/11/2020
Travel industry could lose $24 billion as coronavirus cripples tourism from outside US
The U.S. travel and tourism industry could lose at least $24 billion in foreign spending this year because of the rapidly spreading coronavirus, according to data produced by Tourism Economics and first seen by CNBC.
CNBC • 3/11/2020
Business travel sector to lose $820 billion in revenue on coronavirus hit, industry group says
The global business travel sector is expected to take a revenue hit of about $820 billion, with China accounting for nearly half of the losses, as corporates curb travel plans in the wake of the coronavirus epidemic,
CNBC • 3/11/2020
Major Travel Influencers Say They're Losing Income Due To Coronavirus Precautions
"Things are looking a bit bleak at the moment and there are definitely moments of uncertainty." By Tanya Chen Posted on March 11, 2020, at 12:30 p.m. ET Popular travel influencers say the fears and spread of COVID-19 around the world has impacted their daily lives and bottom lines. One person reported that her income last month was cut in half.
BuzzFeed News • 3/11/2020
Hundreds of Chinese migrants detained at US border amid coronavirus-tied travel ban
EXCLUSIVE: Since officials first reported the coronavirus outbreak in Wuhan in late December and the United States imposed a travel ban for those entering from China, Border Patrol agents have detained 333 Chinese nationals attempting to enter the United States illegally, according to Department of Homeland Security data obtained by Fox News.
Fox News • 3/11/2020
Coronavirus: Roma 'will not travel' to Spain for Sevilla tie after plane not authorised
Roma say they will not be travelling to their Europa League tie with Sevilla on Thursday because their plane from Italy is not authorised to land in Spain. More soon. Share this with Limber up with Greg Jenner for a trip to The Ancient Olympics Get latest scores and headlines sent straight to your phone, sign-up to our newsletter and learn ...
BBC • 3/11/2020
India closes a border, extends travel curbs as regional coronavirus cases rise
India ramped up travel restrictions and closed a border with neighboring Myanmar to counter the coronavirus outbreak, as countries across South Asia reported a rise in cases on Wednesday. The virus has hit Europe and the United States far harder than China’s most immediate neighbors in South Asia,
Reuters • 3/11/2020
South Dakota Confirms First 5 Coronavirus Patients With 1 Death: 'The Cases Are Travel Related'
South Dakota officials on Tuesday announced the state's first known positive cases of coronavirus and one death related to the new disease. In a press conference, Republican Governor Kristi Noem confirmed that five individuals in the state had tested positive for coronavirus,
Newsweek • 3/10/2020
Travel and the Coronavirus: Answers to Your Top Questions
Contemplating travel right now is confusing. Here is advice from experts on how to navigate the changing landscape. As the coronavirus continues to spread across the globe, the question of whether to travel,
New York Times • 3/10/2020
Airlines slash flights, freeze hiring as coronavirus cuts travel
The demand drop-off that began in Asia picked up steam in the U.S. about two weeks ago ... More LAX screeners in self-quarantine amid coronavirus fears; airport workers urge more training Coronavirus warning: Buena Park firm told to stop pitching oils as cures Postponing Coachella, Stagecoach festivals not bad idea, Riverside County’s ...
Orange County Register • 3/10/2020
As Italy Begins Coronavirus Lockdown, Neighbors Limit Travel Ties
Italians responded with resignation and stoicism to an unprecedented nationwide quarantine to fight the coronavirus, as some European countries began to tighten their own restrictions on travelers from the peninsula.
Wall Street Journal • 3/10/2020
Your travel insurance might now cover coronavirus
(CNN)Concerns about coronavirus are causing a lot of people to rethink their travel plans. Until recently, travel insurance wasn't much help in a global health scare. But now some insurers and state regulators are responding to traveler's frustrations and loosening restrictions on travel claims.
CNN • 3/10/2020
Coronavirus Travel: Cruise Line Restrictions and Cancellation Policies
Travel to Thailand will be replaced with more time at seas and extended port times ... On March 2, Virgin announced they are postponing any upcoming events in New York City amid the coronavirus spread and will return for a later date.
NBC New York • 3/10/2020
Delta and American cut flights, freeze hiring as coronavirus hurts travel demand
Delta Air Lines and American Airlines announced deep flight cuts and other cost-saving measures Tuesday as coronavirus poses the biggest threat to travel demand since the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist attacks.
CNBC • 3/10/2020
Coronavirus outbreak hits travel industry
People have grown cautious of traveling in confined spaces like airplanes as the coronavirus continues to spread across the globe. Joann Muller, a transportation correspondent for Axios, joined CBSN to discuss what kind of impact that's having on the travel industry.
CBS News • 3/10/2020
